Imagine an apocalyptic world. Base R decides not to work. sd() doesn't work. It's 
the end of the world, isn't it?


WRONG. Enter StandardDeviationR. Just do:
```
standard_deviation(<input_vector/list>)
```


A usage example:
```
standard_deviation(c(1,2,3,4))
```
